title: Newcastle's Matty Longstaff watches local side after dream debut against Man United
text:
Ever wonder what Premier League stars do after scoring on their debut against Manchester United?

Well, Matty Longstaff took some time out of his day to visit his local side Heaton Stannington during the international break.

An image was posted to social media from the Heaton Stannington account of Longstaff, 19, and his dog in attendance at the club's home stadium, Grounsell Park.

Matty Longstaff paid a visit to his local side during his time off in the International break

Longstaff, 19, scored against Manchester United on his Premier League debut for Newcastle

The 19-year-old made his top-flight debut for Newcastle United last weekend alongside his older brother, Sean, in central midfield and topped off the momentous occasion by scoring the winning goal in the 71st minute.

The youngster's goal sealed a crucial three points for Steve Bruce's side who got their second victory of the season against a plummeting Manchester United.

Matty has since stolen the headlines away from his brother Sean, 21, who has been linked with a £50million move to Ole Gunnar Solskjær's United.

The centre midfielder is out of contract in the summer and will be able to talk to foreign clubs as early as January, should there be offers on the table.

Longstaff will be joining back up with the Newcastle squad after the international break in preparation for their match against Chelsea on Saturday.
